value: Design for a Woven Fabric of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: A partly naturalistic partly stylized rose bough with blossoms and leaves forms vertical rows. Somewhat more than one repeat is shown.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and white gouache on glazed tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1920; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for a Woven Horizontal Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: A moulding and a crest border formed by leaves are at the bottom. Plant caldelabra are to rise from each fifth leaf. Baskets with a plant each are to stand upon a slit spital base in the intervals.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and light blue and white gouache on glazed tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1920; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for a Woven Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Top row: two nosegays consisting of palm leaves and laural boughs fastened together by ribbons, the right nosegay not being entirely shown. Bottom row: six shells, the motifs of which are obliquely shown.

value: Brush and blue, white, and purple gouache on oily tracing paper

value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A row of six shells is shown at the bottom. Vertically disposed boughs with blossoms and leaves rise over it. They rise from behind buyynches of flowers, obliquely dispersed. The ends of the stems are hidden by very large leaves hanging from the end of the boughs. Two motif units are shown.

Design for a Woven Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: The rising waves of an undulating band which have blossoms at their bases are completed to form circles. Falling water and bead chains are shown in them. Over the falling waves stand fountains with springing water and water pouring over the rims. From behind the basin rise boughs with bell-flowers. The units of either motif are shown.
